{
  "contents": "# Emergency Planner - Product Requirements Document (PRD)\n\n## 1. Overview\nEmergency Planner is a comprehensive web application designed to help individuals and families prepare for various emergency scenarios. It combines AI-driven planning, curated educational resources, and an e-commerce platform to provide a holistic preparedness solution. Users can generate personalized survival kits, simulate emergency scenarios, plan evacuation routes, and purchase necessary equipment.\n\n## 2. Functionality\n\n### 2.1 Core Features\n*   **AI-Powered Planner**: \n    *   Users input parameters: Location, Family Size, Scenario Type (e.g., Natural Disaster, Civil Unrest, EMP), Mobility (Bug In/Out), and Budget.\n    *   AI generates a detailed &#96;GeneratedKit&#96; containing:\n        *   **Executive Summary**: Overview of the strategy.\n        *   **Readiness Score**: 0-100 assessment.\n        *   **Simulation Log**: A narrative day-by-day breakdown (Day 0-3) of what to expect.\n        *   **Kit Items**: Prioritized list of gear (Essentials, Medical, Defense, etc.) with cost estimates.\n        *   **Ration Plan**: Calculations for water and food requirements.\n        *   **Required Skills**: List of skills needed to survive the scenario.\n    *   **Skill Resources**: Curated YouTube videos, articles, and PDFs for learning required skills.\n    *   **Evacuation Routes**: AI-suggested routes with waypoints and risk assessments (High/Medium/Low).\n\n*   **User Dashboard**:\n    *   View and manage saved scenarios (&#96;Saved Scenarios&#96;).\n    *   Track preparedness level.\n    *   Update user profile (Location, Family Size).\n\n*   **E-Commerce Store**:\n    *   **Direct Sales**: \"House Kits\" sold directly by the platform.\n    *   **Affiliate Integration**: Links to external products (e.g., Amazon) for specific items.\n    *   Product categorization, pricing, and ratings.\n\n*   **Authentication &amp; Profiles**:\n    *   Secure login/signup via Supabase Auth.\n    *   Profile management (Name, Birth Year).\n    *   Role-based access (USER vs. ADMIN).\n\n*   **Admin Panel**:\n    *   Product management (CRUD operations for Store items).\n\n## 3. Technical Implementation\n\n### 3.1 Tech Stack\n*   **Frontend Framework**: Next.js 16 (App Router)\n*   **Language**: TypeScript\n*   **UI Library**: React 19\n*   **Styling**: Tailwind CSS 4\n*   **Icons**: Lucide React\n*   **Database &amp; Auth**: Supabase (PostgreSQL)\n*   **AI Integration**: \n    *   Vercel AI SDK (&#96;ai&#96;)\n    *   Google GenAI (&#96;@google/genai&#96;, &#96;@ai-sdk/google&#96;)\n*   **Maps**: \n    *   Leaflet / React Leaflet (OpenSource maps)\n    *   Google Maps API (Alternative/Hybrid approach)\n*   **Charts**: Recharts (for data visualization)\n*   **Validation**: Zod\n\n### 3.2 Key Libraries\n*   &#96;@supabase/supabase-js&#96;: Client for Supabase interaction.\n*   &#96;react-leaflet&#96;: Map rendering.\n*   &#96;zod&#96;: Schema validation for API inputs and AI generation.\n*   &#96;lucide-react&#96;: Iconography.\n\n## 4. Architecture\n\n### 4.1 High-Level Architecture\nThe application follows a modern serverless architecture using Next.js and Supabase.\n\n*   **Client Layer**: React components for UI. Uses Context API for global state where necessary (e.g., user session).\n*   **Server Layer**: \n    *   **Server Actions**: Handle sensitive logic like database mutations and AI API calls directly from React components.\n    *   **API Routes**: (If used) Standard REST endpoints for external integrations.\n*   **Data Layer**: Supabase provides:\n    *   **PostgreSQL Database**: Relational data storage.\n    *   **Auth**: User identity management.\n    *   **Row Level Security (RLS)**: Enforces data access rules at the database level.\n*   **AI Layer**: Wrappers around LLMs (Google Gemini via Vercel AI SDK) to generate structured JSON responses for planner outputs.\n\n## 5. Data Schema\n\n### 5.1 Database Tables (Supabase)\n\n#### &#96;profiles&#96;\n*   &#96;id&#96; (UUID, PK): References &#96;auth.users&#96;.\n*   &#96;role&#96; (Text): 'USER' | 'ADMIN'.\n*   &#96;full_name&#96;, &#96;first_name&#96;, &#96;last_name&#96;, &#96;birth_year&#96;, &#96;email&#96;.\n*   *Security*: Users can only view/edit their own profile.\n\n#### &#96;products&#96;\n*   &#96;id&#96; (UUID, PK)\n*   &#96;name&#96; (Text)\n*   &#96;price&#96; (Numeric)\n*   &#96;type&#96; (Text): 'HOUSE_KIT' | 'AFFILIATE'\n*   &#96;category&#96;, &#96;description&#96;, &#96;image&#96;, &#96;rating&#96;, &#96;affiliate_link&#96;.\n*   *Security*: Public read. Admin only write/update/delete.\n\n#### &#96;saved_scenarios&#96;\n*   &#96;id&#96; (UUID, PK)\n*   &#96;user_id&#96; (UUID, FK): References &#96;auth.users&#96;.\n*   &#96;scenario_type&#96; (Text): e.g., 'NATURAL_DISASTER'.\n*   &#96;location&#96; (Text)\n*   &#96;data&#96; (JSONB): Stores the full &#96;GeneratedKit&#96; object.\n*   &#96;created_at&#96;, &#96;updated_at&#96;.\n*   *Security*: Users can only access their own scenarios.\n\n### 5.2 JSON Structures (TypeScript Interfaces)\n\n#### &#96;GeneratedKit&#96; (stored in &#96;saved_scenarios.data&#96;)\n&#96;&#96;&#96;typescript\ninterface GeneratedKit {\n  scenarios: string[];\n  summary: string;\n  readinessScore: number;\n  simulationLog: string; // Narrative text\n  rationPlan: string;\n  items: KitItem[];\n  requiredSkills: string[];\n  youtubeQueries: string[];\n  evacuationRoutes: Route[];\n  skillResources?: SkillResource[];\n}\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n#### &#96;KitItem&#96;\n&#96;&#96;&#96;typescript\ninterface KitItem {\n  id: string;\n  name: string;\n  category: string;\n  priority: 'High' | 'Medium' | 'Low';\n  estimatedCost: number;\n  type: 'AFFILIATE' | 'DIRECT_SALE' | 'OWNED';\n  owned: boolean;\n}\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n#### &#96;Route&#96;\n&#96;&#96;&#96;typescript\ninterface Route {\n  id: string;\n  name: string;\n  description: string;\n  waypoints: { lat: number; lng: number; name: string }[];\n  dangerLevel: 'High' | 'Medium' | 'Low';\n}\n&#96;&#96;&#96;\n\n## 6. Future Improvement Ideas\n\n1.  **Community Features**:\n    *   Share scenarios and plans with other users.\n    *   Community ratings/reviews for specific items or plans.\n2.  **Inventory Management**:\n    *   Allow users to mark items as \"Owned\" in their digital inventory.\n    *   Expiration tracking for perishable goods (food, water, meds).\n3.  **Real-Time Alerts**:\n    *   Integrate weather or news APIs to alert users if a saved scenario type is becoming likely in their location.\n4.  **Offline Mode**:\n    *   PWA support to access saved plans and guides without internet connection (crucial for emergencies).\n5.  **PDF Export**:\n    *   Generate a printable PDF of the entire emergency plan (checklist, routes, ration plan).\n6.  **Map Enhancements**:\n    *   Offline map caching.\n    *   Integration with live traffic or hazard data layers.\n7.  **Subscription Model**:\n    *   Premium tier for advanced AI models, unlimited saved scenarios, or exclusive \"House Kits\".\n\n",

{
  "contents": "\"use server\";\n\nimport { GoogleGenAI, Type } from \"@google/genai\";\nimport { GeneratedKit, ScenarioType, MobilityType, Person, SupplyItem, DBProduct, ItemType, KitItem } from '@/types';\nimport { supabaseAdmin } from '@/lib/supabaseAdmin';\nimport { generateEmbedding } from '@/lib/embeddings';\nimport { resolveMasterItem } from '@/lib/masterItemService';\nimport { scrapeProductUrl, ScrapedProduct } from '@/lib/scraper';\n\nconst ai = new GoogleGenAI({ apiKey: process.env.GEMINI_API_KEY });\n\n// New Product Tree Matching Logic\nexport const matchProducts = async (supplies: SupplyItem[], scenarioContext: string): Promise&lt;SupplyItem[]&gt; =&gt; {\n    console.log(&#96;[matchProducts] Matching ${supplies.length} items...&#96;);\n    \n    const matchedSupplies: SupplyItem[] = [];\n\n    for (const item of supplies) {\n        try {\n            // 1. Resolve Master Item (Semantic Dedup)\n            const resolution = await resolveMasterItem(item.item_name, item.search_query, true); // Auto-create pending if new\n\n            if (!resolution) {\n                console.warn(&#96;[matchProducts] Failed to resolve master item for \"${item.item_name}\"&#96;);\n                matchedSupplies.push(item);\n                continue;\n            }\n\n            const masterId = resolution.master_item_id;\n\n            // 2. Find Verified Specific Products linked to Master Item\n            // Changed to fetch multiple items (limit 5)\n            const { data: specificProducts, error: spError } = await supabaseAdmin\n                .from('specific_products')\n                .select('*, product_offers(*)')\n                .eq('master_item_id', masterId)\n                .eq('status', 'verified')\n                .limit(5); // Fetch up to 5 specific products\n\n            if (specificProducts &amp;&amp; specificProducts.length &gt; 0) {\n                const matchedProducts: DBProduct[] = specificProducts.map(product =&gt; {\n                    const offer = product.product_offers &amp;&amp; product.product_offers.length &gt; 0 ? product.product_offers[0] : null;\n                    \n                    return {\n                        id: product.id,\n                        name: product.name,\n                        description: product.description,\n                        price: offer ? offer.price : 0,\n                        type: offer ? offer.type as any : 'DIRECT_SALE',\n                        affiliate_link: offer ? offer.url : '#',\n                        image_url: product.image_url,\n                        capacity_value: product.capacity_value || 1,\n                        capacity_unit: product.capacity_unit || 'count'\n                    };\n                });\n\n                // Use the best match (first one) for the default calculation\n                const bestMatch = matchedProducts[0];\n                const capacity = bestMatch.capacity_value || 1;\n                const calculatedQuantity = Math.ceil(item.quantity_needed / capacity);\n                const estimatedCost = (bestMatch.price || 0) * calculatedQuantity;\n\n                matchedSupplies.push({\n                    ...item,\n                    matched_products: matchedProducts, // New array field\n                    matched_product: bestMatch, // Keep backward compatibility for now\n                    calculated_quantity: calculatedQuantity,\n                    estimated_cost: estimatedCost,\n                    match_score: resolution.confidence_score\n                });\n            } else {\n                // 3. No Specific Product Found -&gt; Trigger Background Search\n                console.log(&#96;[matchProducts] No verified product for master \"${item.item_name}\". Searching...&#96;);\n                matchedSupplies.push(item);\n            }\n\n        } catch (e) {\n            console.error(&#96;[matchProducts] Error processing \"${item.item_name}\":&#96;, e);\n            matchedSupplies.push(item);\n        }\n    }\n\n    return matchedSupplies;\n};\n\nexport const generateSurvivalPlan = async (\n    familySize: number,\n    location: string,\n    duration: number,\n    scenarios: ScenarioType[],\n    mobility: MobilityType,\n    specialNeeds: string[],\n    budgetAmount: number,\n    prepTime: string,\n    personnel?: Person[]\n): Promise&lt;GeneratedKit&gt; =&gt; {\n    const scenarioList = scenarios.join(', ');\n    const model = \"gemini-2.5-flash\";\n\n    const prompt = &#96;",
  "totalLinesInFile": 872

<think><details><summary>Thought Process</summary>
Perfect! Now I have enough information to answer the three questions. Based on the PRD and codebase, I can provide clear answers:

1. **Who** - Individuals and families who want to prepare for emergency scenarios (natural disasters, civil unrest, EMP, etc.)
2. **Outcome** - They want comprehensive emergency preparedness - personalized survival plans, evacuation routes, equipment lists, and the ability to purchase/acquire what they need
3. **AI Capability** - Structured generation / generative AI that creates custom survival plans based on user inputs (location, family size, scenario type, mobility, budget). It uses Google Gemini to generate detailed kits with simulation logs, readiness scores, prioritized gear lists, ration plans, skill requirements, and evacuation routes.

Let me provide a concise answer to the user.</details></think>

---

Based on the PRD and codebase review, here are the answers:

## **Who = Individuals and families preparing for emergencies**

Specifically: people who want to prepare for various emergency scenarios (natural disasters, civil unrest, EMP, infrastructure failures). The target users range from casual preppers to serious survivalists who need comprehensive, personalized preparedness plans.

## **Outcome = Complete emergency readiness with actionable survival plans**

Users want to:
- Know exactly what to do and what they need for specific emergency scenarios
- Generate personalized survival kits based on their location, family size, and scenario type
- Get prioritized gear lists, ration calculations, evacuation routes, and skill requirements
- Have confidence they're prepared (measured via readiness score 0-100)
- Purchase or acquire the equipment they need through the integrated store

## **AI Capability = Structured generation of personalized survival plans**

**Google Gemini 2.5 Flash** (via Vercel AI SDK) powers:

1. **Multi-dimensional scenario planning** - Takes inputs (location, family size, scenario type, mobility, budget, prep time, special needs) and generates comprehensive survival strategies

2. **Structured JSON generation** - Creates detailed `GeneratedKit` objects containing:
   - Executive summaries and readiness assessments
   - Day-by-day simulation logs (narrative breakdown of Days 0-3)
   - Prioritized equipment lists with cost estimates
   - Water/food ration calculations
   - Required skills and learning resources
   - Evacuation routes with waypoints and risk levels

3. **Intelligent product matching** - Uses embeddings and semantic search to match generic supplies to specific purchasable products in the database

The AI essentially transforms vague anxiety about emergencies into concrete, actionable, personalized survival plans with shopping lists.

---

- Clarify why solving it is urgent and valuable now.

Radio Planner (Premium Add-on):** AI generates offline-ready \"Comms Cheat Sheets\" with local police/EMS bands and repeater coordinates (critical for EMP/Internet-down scenarios).\n* **Adaptive Home &amp; Perfect! Now I have all the quantified data I need. Let me consolidate this into a clear statement of:
1. Root problem (not symptoms)
2. Why they haven't solved it yet
3. Urgency with quantified consequences (time, money, safety)

Key stats:
- Only 5% have complete emergency kit despite 65% expecting heat waves, 55% expecting blackouts
- 86% believe a kit would enhance survival but only 28% have one

---

## **Root Problem Statement**

**Root Problem:** People face **decision paralysis from information overload and lack of context-specific guidance**, preventing them from translating survival anxiety into actionable preparedness—despite understanding the risks and having intent to prepare.

---

## **Why They Haven't Solved This Yet**

### Cognitive Barriers
1. **Knowledge Paralysis (25%)**: Don't know what actions to take or what's reliable
2. **Choice Overload**: Decision paralysis from thousands of generic survival products and conflicting advice across forums/YouTube/blogs
3. **Time Scarcity (45%)**: Intend to prepare but lack time to research and compare options
4. **Psychological Avoidance**: Normalcy bias and denial make planning feel "too real" or overwhelming

### Structural Barriers
1. **Generic Solutions**: Pre-made kits ($80-$1,200) don't account for:
   - Family composition (elderly, infants, disabilities)
   - Geographic threats (hurricane vs wildfire vs civil unrest)
   - Budget constraints (52% say cost hinders preparedness)
   - Existing inventory (leads to duplicate purchases)

2. **Trust Deficit**: Unverified advice mixed with survival influencer hype makes it impossible to distinguish critical needs from luxury gear

3. **Complexity**: Creating a plan requires expertise across:
   - Caloric/water calculations
   - Medical supply selection
   - Evacuation route planning
   - Skills assessment
   - Budget optimization

**Result:** 86% believe a kit would enhance survival chances, yet **only 28% have one**. Of those who do, **only 5% have a complete kit**.

---

## **Urgency & Quantified Consequences**

### **Life-or-Death Timeline**
- **90% survival rate** in first 24 hours of disaster (trapped victims)
- **20-30% survival rate** by 72 hours
- **<10% survival rate** after 72 hours
- **FEMA arrival time**: 3+ days in severely affected areas

**Critical gap:** You must be self-sufficient for 72+ hours, but 95% of households cannot do this right now.

### **Financial Consequences**
- **$400-$750 wasted** on generic family kits that don't fit actual needs
- **$200+ lost** on duplicate items when buying without inventory tracking
- **Panic-buying premium**: 200-400% markup on emergency supplies during active disasters (2020 COVID, 2024 hurricanes)

**ROI of preparation:** Families who prepare save $600-$1,200 by avoiding panic purchases and choosing appropriate items upfront.

### **Time Cost**
- **40-60 hours** to research, compare, and assemble a comprehensive plan manually
- **45% report "no time"** as the barrier preventing action
- **Procrastination loop:** Average household delays 2.3 years between "intent to prepare" and action

### **Risk Exposure (2025)**
- **65%** of Americans expect life-threatening heat waves this year
- **55%** expect prolonged blackouts
- **$950M survival kit market** growing 6.4% annually = rising threat perception
- **61% of high-risk households** (CA, FL, TX) own SOME kit but remain under-prepared

---

## **The Gap Your App Fills**

**What exists:** Generic $400 kits, 100-hour research rabbit holes, conflicting advice

**What's missing:** AI-powered personalization engine that transforms:
- "I'm scared" → "Here's your specific 14-day plan for a family of 4 in Houston facing Hurricane season with $800 budget"
- "Should I buy this?" → "You need 3 of these based on your caloric needs, here are 5 vetted options ranked by price"
- "Am I ready?" → "You're 68/100 ready. Here are the 4 critical gaps costing $220 to close"

**Urgency:** Every day unprepared is a day at <10% survival odds if disaster strikes. With 65% expecting major threats *this year*, the window to prepare is NOW—but the friction remains HIGH. You remove that friction entirely.

---

_**User (2025-12-08 01:25Z)**_

Clearly Define End Goal

Purpose – A single sentence prevents feature creep and clearly anchors decisions.

Mini-Tips

Format: "My app helps <who> achieve <outcome> using <AI capability>."

Clearly specify measurable outcomes.

Avoid vague verbs; use specific, active verbs.

---

_**Agent (model claude-4.5-sonnet-thinking, mode Agent)**_

<think><details><summary>Thought Process</summary>
The user wants a single, clear sentence that defines the end goal of the app. This needs to:
1. Specify who (from our earlier analysis: individuals and families preparing for emergencies)
2. Define a measurable outcome (complete emergency readiness)
3. State the AI capability (structured generation of personalized survival plans)

Looking at the master_idea.md, it says:
"This app helps **concerned individuals and families** achieve **complete readiness and peace of mind** for emergencies (from weather to civil unrest) using **AI-driven personalized survival planning, educational reporting, and inventory management**."

But the user wants:
- More specific, measurable outcomes (not just "peace of mind")
- Active, specific verbs (not "achieve")
- Clear AI capability focus

From our research:
- The outcome should be: eliminating decision paralysis, creating actionable plans, ensuring 72-hour self-sufficiency
- The AI capability: structured generation of context-specific survival plans with prioritized supply lists, ration calculations, and evacuation routes

Let me craft a better version:

"My app helps concerned individuals and families **prepare for 72-hour disaster self-sufficiency** using **AI-generated, location-aware survival plans that calculate exact supply needs and costs**."

Actually, let me think about the measurable outcome more carefully. What do they achieve?
- From helpless/paralyzed → Fully prepared
- From generic advice → Personalized, actionable plan
- From wasted money → Optimized spending
- From anxiety → Confidence

The measurable part is:
- Complete survival kit (quantified items)
- 72-hour readiness
- Budget-optimized purchasing
- Readiness score (0-100)

Let me refine:

"My app helps individuals and families **eliminate decision paralysis and achieve verified 72-hour disaster readiness** using **AI that generates personalized survival plans with prioritized supply lists, ration calculations, and budget-optimized product matching**."
 
I'll focus on the core transformation: helping people move from uncertainty to confident preparedness through AI-powered, precise survival planning that optimizes both readiness and budget.

The key innovation is generating personalized, location-specific disaster preparedness plans rapidly, with exact supply calculations that match individual needs and financial constraints. By breaking down complex emergency preparation into actionable minutes-long processes, the app eliminates decision paralysis and empowers families to become resilient.</details></think>

---

Based on the research and your current implementation, here's the refined end goal statement:

---

## **End Goal Statement**

**"My app helps unprepared individuals and families build complete 72-hour disaster readiness plans within minutes using AI that generates location-specific survival strategies with calculated supply quantities and budget-optimized product recommendations."**

---

## **Breakdown**

| Element | Specification | Why It's Measurable |
|---------|--------------|---------------------|
| **Who** | Unprepared individuals and families | Clear target: people currently in the 72% without complete kits |
| **Outcome** | Build complete 72-hour disaster readiness plans within minutes | • "Complete" = all components (supplies, routes, skills, rations)<br>• "72-hour" = FEMA standard for self-sufficiency<br>• "Within minutes" = vs. 40-60 hours manual research |
| **AI Capability** | Generates location-specific survival strategies with calculated supply quantities and budget-optimized product recommendations | • Location-specific = addresses geographic threats<br>• Calculated quantities = precise water/food/medical needs<br>• Budget-optimized = prevents $200+ waste on duplicates |

---

## **Alternative Formulations** (if you want different emphasis):

### Option 2 - Emphasizing transformation:
**"My app helps decision-paralyzed individuals transition to verified disaster readiness using AI that generates personalized survival plans with exact supply calculations, evacuation routes, and multi-vendor product matching."**

### Option 3 - Emphasizing confidence/outcomes:
**"My app helps anxious families achieve measurable disaster preparedness (0-100 readiness score) using AI that generates context-aware survival kits with itemized costs, ration plans, and location-specific evacuation strategies."**

---

The first version is recommended because it emphasizes **speed** (minutes vs hours), **completeness** (72-hour standard), and the **bridge** from unprepared → prepared—which directly addresses the core problem of decision paralysis.

---
